questions.question_text:
You work as a Systems Administrator for your company. The company has a subscription to Microsoft 365. All users in your company have a Microsoft 365 E3 license.
You plan to host live events in Microsoft Teams.
You discover that external users are unable to access the live events. Company users and users with guest accounts are able to access the live events.
You need to configure the system to allow external users without guest accounts to access the live events.
Which of the following should you configure?

discussion.content:
Yes. In the teams admin center, Meetings > Live events policies > “who can join scheduled events”
Options are:
Everyone
Everyone in the org.
Specific users or groups

Selected Answer: D
TAC > Meetings > Live events policies > Manage Policies tab; create or edit policy to change "Who can join scheduled events" to "Everyone" 
Users can create live events that everyone, including people outside your organization, can attend. 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/teams-live-events/set-up-for-teams-live-events

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct option because Live events settings allow you to configure external access for users without guest accounts, enabling them to join the live events.
d is correct but only after A is done.
D, Who can join scheduled live events -> Set to Everyone.

A. The External Access Org-wide settings

To allow external users without guest accounts to access live events in Microsoft Teams, you should configure the External Access Org-wide settings. These settings allow you to control the level of access that external users have to your organization's Teams resources, including live events. You can configure the settings to allow external users to access live events, and you can also set different levels of access for different types of external users.

By default, external access is turned off and you need to enable it to allow external users to access live events.

It's important to note that the other options (B, C, D) doesn't have any relation with the access of external users to live events.
... ChatGPT said

Selected Answer: A
I dont see any setting related to external access in live events policy, so It is A for me

comments.content: Don't you have to allow external access in Org wide setting first. isn't disable by default???
You can configure that "Everyone" can join events. So D is correct in my opinion.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Correct

Selected Answer: D
Correct

Selected Answer: D
correct answer is D

questions.question_text:
You work as a Systems Administrator for your company. The company has a subscription to Microsoft 365. The company has 1,000 users. All users in your company have a Microsoft 365 E3 license.
Approximately 400 of the users currently use Microsoft Teams for collaboration. The other 600 users use Microsoft Skype for Business Online for collaboration.
You plan to migrate all users to Microsoft Teams over the next three months. The coexistence mode is currently set to Islands.
You need to ensure that company users do not miss chat messages sent by other company users.
What should you do?

discussion.content:
Right answer
In this coexistence mode, called Islands, each of the client applications operates as a separate island. Skype for Business talks to Skype for Business, and Teams talks to Teams. Users are expected to run both clients at all times and can communicate natively in the client from which the communication was started

Selected Answer: B
B is the best option as changing the coexistence mode to Teams only ensures all users are using Teams as the single platform for collaboration, preventing any missed chat messages between users.
This is the situation for the environment I currently work in, we need to keep both apps active.

Fricked up question. I would be inclined to D as the focus is on Chat messages. SFB doesn't have "Collaboration". Collaboration is a Teams term. both C and D are technically correct, but anyone with real world experience would have set the SFB with Teams Collab at the beginning, once released to the wild, good luck getting anything turned off or clawed back, thus would have to go with C.
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
correct answer is C

choices.D: Change the coexistence mode to Skype for Business with Teams collaboration.
choices.C: Ensure that all users have both Microsoft Skype for Business and Microsoft Teams installed and are signed in to both applications.
choices.B: Change the coexistence mode to Teams only.
choices.A: Ensure that all users are signed in to either Microsoft Skype for Business or Microsoft Teams.
Modify the default Meeting policy in the Microsoft Teams admin center.

questions.question_text:
You work as a Systems Administrator for your company. The company has a subscription to Microsoft 365. All users in your company have a Microsoft 365 E3 license.
You have been migrating users from Microsoft Skype for Business Online to Microsoft Teams over the last two months. Most users are now using Microsoft
Teams.
The coexistence mode is currently set to Islands.
You plan to change the coexistence mode to Teams Only to force all users to use Microsoft Teams.
You need to ensure that if any users have online meetings scheduled to use Skype for Business, the meetings are converted to use Microsoft Teams.
Which of the following actions should you perform?

discussion.content:
MMS is triggered in each of the following cases:
-When a user is migrated from on-premises to the cloud
-When an admin makes a change to the user’s audio conferencing settings
-When the user's mode in TeamsUpgradePolicy is set to either TeamsOnly or SfBWithTeamsCollabAndMeetings (using either Powershell or the Teams Admin Portal)
-When you use the PowerShell cmdlet, Start-CsExMeetingMigration

So technically MMS already gets triggered when the user is switched to Teams Only. But hey, to be certain, you can run Start-CsExMeetingMigration I guess :-)

Selected Answer: B
B:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/skype/start-csexmeetingmigration?view=skype-ps

" 
MMS is designed to eliminate the need for users to run the Meeting Migration Tool to update their Skype for Business and Microsoft Teams meetings
 "
Strange question and very uncomplete in lack of more details than just running a command...but yeah, the command "Start-CsExMeetingMigration" is right.
@Seb1979 MMS stands for Meeting Migration Service
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
correct answer is B
Answer is correct...
Sorry what is MMS for please ?

questions.question_text:
You work as a Systems Administrator for your company. The company has departments named Sales, Accounts, Research and Production.
The company has recently purchased a subscription to Microsoft 365.
All users in your company have a Microsoft 365 E3 license.
You are in the process of configuring Microsoft Teams. You plan to create a team for each of the company departments.
All users have the Microsoft Teams desktop client installed.
You need to ensure that the Research team is labelled as Confidential when viewed in the Microsoft Teams client.
Which of the following actions should you perform?

choices.B: Configure and publish a Retention Label in the Security & Compliance admin center.
choices.C: Configure a Teams policy in the Microsoft Teams admin center.
choices.A: Configure and publish a Sensitivity Label in the Security & Compliance admin center.
choices.D: Configure the Meeting Settings in the Microsoft Teams admin center.

discussion.content:
ANSWER IS CORRECT, OPTION A
In the Security & Compliance Center, you can configure and publish a Sensitivity Label, that you can applied during a team creation. Sensitivity labels allow Teams admin to protect and regulate access to sensitive organizational content, the benefit of using it is that their policies are automatically enforced end-to-end. A team owner can change the sensitivity label and the privacy setting of the team at any time by editing the Team.

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A

comments.content: Did you appear for the exam recently?

discussion.content: I believe the new approach in applying sensitivity labels is being done in Microsoft Entra ID, whether you are about to create a new group or existing one.

Selected Answer: A
Configure and publish a Sensitivity Label in the Security & Compliance admin center.
Configure and publish a Sensitivity Label in the Security & Compliance admin center.

Selected Answer: A
of course!

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A
Answer is correct...

Use sensitivity labels with Microsoft Teams, Microsoft 365 groups, and SharePoint sites - Microsoft 365 Compliance | Microsoft Docs
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/sensitivity-labels-teams-groups-sites?view=o365-worldwide#using-sensitivity-labels-for-microsoft-teams-microsoft-365-groups-and-sharepoint-sites

Selected Answer: D
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-app-setup-policies

comments.content: Sorry, it's D. After reading the question again, they only want to make this app visible in Teams. By default all apps are available and using a setup policy you can make visible in the Teams client (making it easier for the users to find it)

discussion.content: It's B. With app permission policies, Teams admin control what apps are available to each user in their organizationhttps://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/app-policies

Selected Answer: D
Configurar uma política de permissão de aplicativo do Teams personalizada (opção B) não é necessário, pois os usuários do departamento de Marketing já possuem a licença do Microsoft 365 E3, que inclui o Microsoft Bookings.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct.
Per default, all apps are allowed in a tennant. 
I read nothing about only certain apps being allowed, so i only have do "add the Bookings app". And for this, you havt to configure the app Setup policy
The Teams admin center states "App permission policies control what apps you want to make available to Teams users in your organization." So It cannot be D.

Selected Answer: B
B) Before to add an app into a setup policy you need to add the same app into a Teams app Permission policy, else the setup policy wont work. So setup policy is an extra and in consequence "B" is the right choice
Why not B+D? I'd say that you still need to make sure that Bookings is permitted and then add the setup policy for the users.

Selected Answer: D
correct answer is D
Answer is correct...

comments.content: D is correct. B IS NOT correct. TAC -> Teams apps -> setup policy -> create new policy and add bookings from the list. Then manage the users and assign to marketing only
F is the correct answer, ACDC is not correct.

discussion.content: provided answer is not correct. B is correct

questions.question_text:
You work as a Systems Administrator for your company. The company has recently purchased a subscription to Microsoft 365. All users in your company have a
Microsoft 365 E3 license.
You are in the process of configuring Microsoft Teams.
Users in the Marketing department frequently organize events such as trade shows. Organizing an event requires the management of bookings for several resources involved in the event.
You want to add the Microsoft Bookings app to the Microsoft Teams client for the users in the Marketing department.
Which of the following actions should you perform?

choices.A: Configure a custom Configuration Profile that applies to the Marketing users.
choices.B: Configure a custom Teams app Permission policy that applies to the Marketing users.
choices.D: Configure a custom Teams app Setup policy that applies to the Marketing users.
choices.C: Configure a custom Teams upgrade policy that applies to the Marketing users.
